attributes.text: The Flash widget embeds the HMTL Flash element
The URL of the Flash movie to display.
The unique id for the Flash movie.
Constructs a flash widget.

Fired after the flash object has been loaded.

The loaded action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

Fired when the flash object still is loading.

The loading action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

Fired after the flash object has got a timeout.

The timeout action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object
Flash Player attribute name.
The value for the attribute, null if the attribute should be removed from the DOM element.
Set the attribute for the Flash DOM element.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Checks the current loaded state and fires one of the defined events: {@link #loading}, {@link #loaded} or {@link #timeout}.

Note the {@link #timeout} event is fired when the check reached the defined {@link #loadTimeout}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property allowScriptAccess.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowScriptAccess}.
(Computed) value of allowScriptAccess.

Returns the DOM element of the Flash movie.

Note: If you call the method before the widget is rendered, it will always return null. Therefore call the method after the {@link #appear} event is fired.
The DOM element of the Flash movie.

Initial value for property allowScriptAccess.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property allowScriptAccess with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowScriptAccess}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property liveConnect equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #liveConnect}.
Whether the property equals true.
Checks if the movie is loaded.
true When the movie is completely loaded, otherwise false.

Resets the user value of the property allowScriptAccess.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowScriptAccess}.
